front.title: Timestamp extension flag for In Situ Operations, Administration, and Maintenance (IOAM) Direct Export

abstract.t: This document defines new extension flags for the In Situ Operations, Administration, and Maintenance (IOAM) Direct Export option type. The new flags allow IOAM DEX Option-type to add a timestamp into the header.

note.title: Requirements Language
note.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "NOT RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in BCP 14 when, and only when, they appear in all capitals, as shown here.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: Network operators require delay monitoring accros their network, notably when some services undergo long end-to-end delays. Nodes can use IOAM in order to report this delay to a collector.
This document defines two new Extension flags for IOAM DEX Option-type to be able to add a timestamp in the header.
